entry.title: Arndt Jorgens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Arndt Jorgens (pictured) won five World Series despite not playing in a game?

entry.title: ice (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 28 trillion tonnes of ice were lost worldwide between 1994 and 2017 due to climate change?

entry.title: Daniel Chapo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Daniel Chapo, the favorite to be the next president of Mozambique, was previously a radio announcer?

entry.title: relations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to some metaphysicians, there are no relations?

entry.title: William Henry Harrison Seeley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William Henry Harrison Seeley was the first American recipient of the Victoria Cross?

entry.title: hock burns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that farmed birds often get marks known as hock burns from the ammonia of other birds' waste?

entry.title: Victor Jacob Koningsberger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the botanist Victor Jacob Koningsberger spoke out against the expulsion of Jewish academics in the occupied Netherlands?

entry.title: Minnesota State Highway 36 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that there's a Little Canada on Minnesota State Highway 36?

entry.title: David W. Music (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that David W. Music has taught music, composed music, conducted music, and written about music?
